subject: Programming
title: Machine Learning as Algorithms
description: Learn Machine Learning as Algorithms in one minute.

hook.text: Traditional algorithms follow instructions. Machine learning algorithms find their own rules.

buildup.text: A ML algorithm takes data, discovers patterns, and builds a model that predicts new outcomes.

discovery.text: No human writes the rules. The algorithm learns from millions of examples and adjusts itself.

twist.text: ML models are often black boxes. They work, but nobody fully understands why.

climax.text: From spam filters to self-driving cars, ML algorithms now make decisions humans can't explain.

punchline.text: The algorithm writes its own instructions now.

quiz.question: How do machine learning algorithms differ from traditional ones?
options: They discover their own rules from data
